quotes.quote: Entitlement is the opposite of enchantment.
Gratitude begins where my sense of entitlement ends.
A sense of entitlement is a cancerous thought process that is void of gratitude and can be deadly to our relationships.
Thankfulness eradicates entitlement.
What separates privilege from entitlement is gratitude.
An attitude of entitlement is inversely related to one of gratitude.
When we replace a sense of service and gratitude with a sense of entitlement and expectation, we quickly see the demise of our relationships, society, and economy.
Pride and entitlement always go with unforgiveness. The longer you hold someone's offense over them, the more likely you are to start feeling arrogant and entitled to your posture toward him.
Entitlement creates an illusion of superiority that clouds our ability of self-improvisation.
When a parent shows up with an attitude of entitlement, understand that under it is a boatload of anxiety.
It is true that, when an entitlement begins to be enjoyed by people, they like to keep it.
No major entitlement, once it has been implemented, has ever been unwound.
Male privilege and entitlement are dying a very painful death; no one gives up power without a struggle.
Once an entitlement program has been created with millions of beneficiaries, it becomes almost impossible to repeal.
People who are given whatever they want soon develop a sense of entitlement and rapidly lose their sense of proportion.
The most capricious modern entitlement is not just Social Security but to self-esteem.
There's no such thing as entitlement, unless someone has first met an obligation.
What annoys people is the idea that somebody has everything, and they're allowed to get away with anything. It's the sense of entitlement that gets up people's noses.
Thankfulness is difficult to express when one starts with an attitude of entitlement.

Entitlement is an expression of conditional love. Nobody is ever entitled to your love. You always have a right to protect your mental, emotional, and physical well-being by removing yourself from toxic people and circumstances.
Grace destroys entitlement.
You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your informed opinion. No one is entitled to be ignorant.
Everyone is entitled to his own nostalgia.
Every righteous man or woman is entitled to revelation concerning his own affairs.
If you're entitled, you likely think you know more than you do.
We are each entitled to our own opinion, but no one is entitled to his own facts.
Every man is entitled to be valued by his best moment.
Everybody should be entitled to one lie, one failing, one infidelity.
Everyone is entitled to their own opinions, which people don't seem to be shy about expressing.
Don't feel entitled to anything you didn't sweat and struggle for.
You are perfectly entitled to invent your life and to claim that it's true.
We are all entitled to our little harmless habits, but we are not entitled to demand approval for them.
Entitlement is lethal.
People who take more than their share usually feel an inflated sense of entitlement.
A man is entitled to a few secrets.
You are entitled to your own success.
Entitlement? How can you be entitled to someone else's money?
We're all entitled to our superstitions.
